meanings.definition: The action of supervising or monitoring a group of people during an examination or test.
meanings.sent1: During the invigilations, the teacher walked around the room to make sure no one was cheating.
meanings.sent2: The invigilations at the school were conducted by trained staff members.
meanings.sent3: The invigilations turned into a game of hide-and-seek as the students tried to outsmart the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The invigilations were like vigilant guardians protecting the integrity of the exam.
meanings.sent5: The invigilations were so strict that even a slight movement could attract attention.

meanings.definition: The act of keeping watch over a group of individuals to ensure compliance with rules or regulations.
meanings.sent1: The invigilations were necessary to maintain order and fairness during the competition.
meanings.sent2: Security invigilations were in place to prevent any unauthorized access to the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: The invigilations felt like being under constant surveillance, even in the restroom.
meanings.sent4: The invigilations functioned as invisible referees ensuring everyone played by the rules.
meanings.sent5: The invigilations were as vigilant as a hawk, spotting any potential violations instantly.
